title: Stoltenhoff Island
text:
Stoltenhoff Island is a small uninhabited island in the <a href="South%20Atlantic%20Ocean">South Atlantic Ocean</a>, part of the <a href="Nightingale%20Islands">Nightingale Islands</a>. It is the smallest of the Nightingale Islands, and is to the north west of Nightingale Island itself. They are governed as part of <a href="Tristan%20da%20Cunha">Tristan da Cunha</a>, an archipelago and part of the <a href="British%20overseas%20territory">British overseas territory</a> of <a href="Saint%20Helena%2C%20Ascension%20and%20Tristan%20da%20Cunha">Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha</a>. The island is part of the Nightingale Islands group <a href="Important%20Bird%20Area">Important Bird Area</a> (IBA), identified as such by <a href="BirdLife%20International">BirdLife International</a> as a breeding site for <a href="seabird">seabird</a>s and endemic landbirds.
The island is named after the two brothers Gustav and Friedrich Stoltenhoff who tried to settle on nearby <a href="Inaccessible%20Island">Inaccessible Island</a>. Their attempt was abandoned after two difficult years.
